introduction: This video delves into the reasons behind the slow performance of the SELECT \* statement in a relational database. It explores the impact of full table scans, deserialization costs, and network latency on query performance.

sections.title: Section 1: Full Table Scans
content: Explanation of how full table scans are performed in a relational database.
Discussion on the performance impact of full table scans.
Comparison between index-based and index-only scans.
Explanation of how to optimize queries using indexes.

sections.title: Section 2: Deserialization Costs
content: Explanation of deserialization costs in a relational database.
Discussion on the impact of deserialization costs on query performance.
Explanation of how to minimize deserialization costs.
Comparison between deserialization costs in different databases.

sections.title: Section 3: Network Latency
content: Explanation of network latency and its impact on query performance.
Discussion on how to minimize network latency.
Comparison between network latency in different databases and network configurations.
Explanation of how to optimize network configurations for better performance.

sections.title: Section 4: Lazy Deserialization
content: Explanation of lazy deserialization and its impact on query performance.
Discussion on how to use lazy deserialization for better performance.
Comparison between lazy deserialization and eager deserialization.
Explanation of how to implement lazy deserialization in different databases.

sections.title: Section 5: Avoiding Unnecessary Data
content: Explanation of how to avoid sending unnecessary data over the network.
Discussion on the importance of minimizing data transfer.
Comparison between different data transfer methods and their impact on performance.
Explanation of how to optimize data transfer for better performance.
